title: AZ-104 Storage and Data Management Questions
description: Focused question bank for Azure Storage and Data Management topics

questions.question: You need to configure Azure Blob Storage to automatically move blobs to the Cool tier after 30 days and to the Archive tier after 90 days. What should you configure?
questions.explanation: Lifecycle management policies allow you to automatically transition blobs between access tiers based on rules you define, optimizing storage costs.

questions.question: Which Azure Storage service should you use to share files across multiple virtual machines using the SMB protocol?
questions.explanation: Azure Files provides fully managed file shares in the cloud accessible via SMB and NFS protocols, perfect for sharing files across multiple VMs.

questions.question: What is the maximum size of a single blob in Azure Blob Storage?
questions.explanation: Azure Blob Storage supports blobs up to 190.7 TB in size for block blobs, making it suitable for very large files and datasets.

questions.question: You need to ensure that deleted blobs are recoverable for 30 days. What should you enable?
questions.explanation: Soft delete for blobs protects your data from being accidentally or erroneously modified or deleted, allowing recovery within the retention period.

questions.question: Which tool should you use to transfer large amounts of data to Azure when network bandwidth is limited?
questions.explanation: Azure Data Box is a physical device that allows you to transfer large amounts of data to Azure when network transfer is not practical due to time or cost constraints.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Azure Storage access keys?
questions.correct_answer: Provide full access to all storage services and data in the storage account
questions.explanation: Storage access keys provide full access to all storage services and data in a storage account. They should be protected and rotated regularly.

questions.question: Which Azure service provides a NoSQL database for storing and querying large amounts of structured data?
questions.explanation: Azure Table Storage is a NoSQL key-value store for rapid development using massive semi-structured datasets. It's part of Azure Storage services.

questions.question: You need to encrypt data in transit to Azure Storage. Which protocol should you use?
questions.explanation: HTTPS/TLS encrypts data in transit to Azure Storage. Azure Storage requires HTTPS for secure transfers and can be configured to refuse HTTP requests.

questions.question: What is the difference between Standard and Premium storage performance tiers?
questions.correct_answer: Premium storage uses SSDs for higher IOPS and lower latency
wrong_answers: Premium storage provides more storage capacity
Premium storage supports more replication options
questions.explanation: Premium storage uses solid-state drives (SSDs) to provide high-performance, low-latency disk support for VMs running I/O-intensive workloads.

questions.question: Which Azure Storage redundancy option replicates data across availability zones?
questions.explanation: Zone-redundant storage (ZRS) replicates data synchronously across three Azure availability zones in the primary region, providing protection against zone failures.
